sense.name: (cause to) violently impact and undergo destruction
sense.examples: His small private plane crashed into a residential high-rise building on New York. He hit the earthen bank protecting the crowd and the Mercedes crashed into pieces. His massive tail crashed against the younger beast's ugly head. As I moved toward the captain's cabin, a wave crashed against the uppermost deck. Mo crashed her fork down on her plate.

sense.name: make a crashing noise
sense.examples: Flutes blew heraldic fragments while bass drum and cymbals crashed on off-beats.

sense.name: enter or participate uninvited
sense.examples: Forget the pride he felt at having successfully crashed the Plaza Hotel wedding. Greens say Republicans crashed their party.

sense.name: experience severe downturn or malfunction
sense.examples: Millionaire margin investors became bankrupt instantly as the stock market crashed. The team returns to the 1999 death of a young woman whose dotcom business crashed. My computer crashed and I was forced to re-install all programs again. New electronic voting machines malfunctioned and the county's phone system crashed .

sense.name: sleep in a convenient place
sense.examples: Do you think it would be alright if I could just crash here tonight? A friend of mine crashed on the couch while he established himself in NYC for about a month.
